data.title: Max Switzer - Head Women's Flag Football Coach - Staff Directory
data.meta_description: Max Switzer is entering his second year as the head coach for the women’s flag football team at Hesston College after leading the inaugural team to an 8-7 record
data.text:
Max Switzer is entering his second year as the head coach for the women’s flag football team at Hesston College after leading the inaugural team to an 8-7 record and a runner-up finish at the NJCAA national championships.

A native of Troup, Texas, Switzer earned his bachelor’s degree from Tabor (Kan.) College. After obtaining his degree he spent time as a position coach at Tabor for two years.

Switzer would go on to spend six years coaching at Newton HS in Newton, Kan. Five of those years were spent coaching middle school track and freshman girl’s basketball and for four years he spent as a defensive coordinator and position coach for the football team. Max also spent some time as the head coach of the Wichita Tribe, a professional women’s tackle football team.

Max and his wife, Jenny, live in Newton.
